About the team The Zillow Premier Agent team is innovating on the next generation of real estate agent software. We have the industry-leading platform for real estate agents and our platform is growing. With unmatched consumer reach to over 200 million users across Zillow and Trulia, our team’s platforms are a critical piece of the Premier Agent infrastructure that enables agents to quickly connect and interact with interested buyers and sellers.     About the role      We are a highly-effective full stack engineering team made up of team members who truly want what's best for the customer, our partners, and each other.      Our front-end stack includes JavaScript & React. Our back-end platform is built with services written in Node.js, PHP, Python, & Go, GraphQL, Kafka and databases in MS SQL Server, document store such as DynamoDB, Redis, & Elasticsearch. We write our infrastructure as code and host our apps on AWS. We use Gitlab for our deployment pipelines and code repositories. We test our code before we ship. We are agile.     This role has been categorized as a Remote position. “Remote” employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.    In Colorado, the standard pay range for this role is $120,900.00 - $193,100.00 Annually. This range is specific to Colorado and may not be applicable to other locations.     Who you are   You have 3+ years of experience working as a software engineer, solving problems on both the frontend and backend. PHP, NodeJS, Python, and React are a plus.  You have a passion for writing clean and well-tested code.  You have experience building and integrating with both RESTful APIs and messaging systems.  You can work with distributed systems, and would be comfortable supporting multiple microservices and serverless architectures.  You have worked in DevOps environments and are comfortable working with cloud services. AWS experience is a plus.  You know how to troubleshoot application performance issues on several levels, including at the client, operating system, network, and persistence layers.   In addition to a competitive base salary this position is also eligible for equity awards based on factors such as experience, performance and location.     Get to know us  Zillow is reimagining real estate to make it easier to unlock life’s next chapter.   As the most-visited real estate website in the United States, Zillow® and its affiliates offer customers an on-demand real experience. Millions of people visit Zillow Group sites every month to start their home search, and now they can rely on Zillow to help make it easier to move — and no matter what job you're in, you will play a critical role in making this vision a reality.  Our efforts to streamline the real estate transaction are supported by a deep-rooted culture of innovation, our passion to redefine the employee experience, a fundamental commitment to Equity and Belonging, and world-class benefits. We're also building the workplace of the future, where our employees are less tethered to the office, and have more flexibility in their lives. But don’t just take our word for it. Read recent reviews on Glassdoor and recent recognition from multiple organizations, including: Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For® List 2021, TIME 100 Most Influential Companies list, Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index 2021, Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Corporate Equity Index and HRC’s Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality 2021, Fortune Best Workplaces for Millennials 2021, and Fortune Best Workplaces for Women 2021.   Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at RecruitingAccessibility@zillowgroup.com.   Applicants who receive job offers from Zillow Group will be asked to sign a Proprietary Rights Agreement which includes confidentiality, intellectual property assignment, customer and employee non-solicitation, and non-competition provisions. If you are contacted for a role at Zillow Group and wish to review a copy of the Proprietary Rights Agreement prior to receiving an offer, you may request a copy from your Recruiter.   See what information we collect about you.

Job description Melco International LLC is a developer of Software and Hardware for the Commercial Machine Embroidery space headquartered in the North Denver Colorado area. Our customers range from Fortune 500 apparel manufacturers to smaller independent businesses. We have many novel and patented core technologies that we apply to design automation and control systems automation. We are looking to add a highly skilled Web Developer to our close knit, professional group. We have a great team atmosphere and pride ourselves on teamwork and productivity. Melco International has just celebrated 50 years of innovation, execution, and being a great place to work. Our Mid-Level Web Developer role is responsible for implementation/design of .NET Core and ASP.NET SaaS web applications with frequent database interaction. We are looking for someone with at least 2-3 years experience with back end developing. This role can be performed on site at our offices, hybrid, or 100% remote. For remote, our Web Developer would be require to come to our Melco office for onboarding and then regular 3 to 6 month intervals as needed Essential Functions · Develop, enhance, and maintain existing ASP.NET MVC web applications, and new .NET Core web applications · Role is primarily back end with regular opportunities to also work on Javascript/JQuery and React front end · Work with product managers, developers, and application experts to enhance established applications as well as develop emerging web applications · Participate with team members to provide input on product development, and then design and develop solutions · Take key role in full life cycle of software development Competencies · Communication proficiency, including the ability to clearly converse, read, and write in English on the phone and in email · Strong analytical skills with the ability to utilize information to determine root causes to technical problems, and to verbally communicate complex concepts · ASP.NET using C# and MVC (.NET 4.0+), .NET Core · SQL, MS SQL, LINQ · Object Oriented Programming · HTML/CSS, JavaScript, AJAX/JQuery/JSON, DOM · XML, Open API standard · NET Web Services (REST web services) · Full Life Cycle development · Agile (SCRUM) · Automated testing, including Unit Testing/TDD and Microsoft testing frameworks Job Type: Full-time Pay: $90,000.00 - $110,000.00 per year Benefits:  401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Employee discount Flexible spending account Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Vision insurance  Schedule:  8 hour shift Monday to Friday  Education:  Bachelor's (Required)  Experience:  Web development: 5 years (Required) Back-end development: 5 years (Required) APIs: 3 years (Required)  Work Location: Remote

Senaptec Portland, OR We are looking for an enthusiastic and adventurous software engineer to join our team. At Senaptec, we are all about improving your sensory skills. This helps people in all areas of life. Better senses provide athletes an edge to see and react quicker. Better senses help seniors maintain independence and quality of life. Senaptec provides tools to connect the eyes, brain and body by integrating science, technology, and algorithms to measure and improve sensory performance. ROLE As a Backend Software Engineer, your primary focus will be working on the backend to support a growing suite of mobile applications. Our backend team works under a DevOps model, and takes an ownership role from development and testing to deployment and operations. One of the core values at Senaptec is to "Build Better". On the engineering team, you will be encouraged to continuously improve, learn, and grow by openly sharing mistakes and learning from them. REQUIREMENTS -3+ years of professional software development experience -A good understanding of functional programming concepts -Working knowledge of backend development, including API and database design -Solid understanding of the full web technology stack (HTTP, cookies, REST, websockets, etc.) -Pragmatic and focused on delivering value. Ability to strike a balance between "ready to ship" and "perfect" -Desire for the autonomy of a small team, and the responsibility that comes with it -A high level of gumption Desirable -Familiarity with AWS (S3, RDS) -Experience with Elixir, either in a production environment, OSS, or from side projects. Job will not be Elixir focused, but experience is helpful for legacy systems. -Experience in a small-team environment -Front-end chops -DevOps experience -Familiarity with Android or iOS app development Job Type: Full-time Pay: $95,000.00 - $145,000.00 per year Benefits:  401(k) Flexible schedule Paid time off  Schedule:  Monday to Friday  Supplemental Pay:  Bonus pay  COVID-19 considerations:Senaptec follows local government guidance on COVID-19 precautions. Experience:  AWS: 1 year (Preferred) Back End Developer: 3 years (Required) ASP.NET: 1 year (Preferred) APIs: 1 year (Preferred)  Work Location: Remote
